intro: Oxytropis lunata, commonly known as the moonflower oxytropis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, legume-like pods that contain seeds. Oxytropis lunata is often found in alpine meadows and is known for its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
